column1: A day after the Senate acquitted Donald Trump in a historic second impeachment trial America was weighing how long a shadow the former president will cast -- over his party and over the country. The Senate on Saturday voted 57-43 to convict Trump of inciting the January 6 assault on the US Capitol.  It was a stinging rebuke with seven Republicans joining all Democrats in the most bipartisan impeachment vote ever but it fell far short of the 67 votes needed for conviction.    With Trump hinting afterward at a possible political future even as other Republicans said it was time to move on the stark divide facing the party was on full view.
